5476.verse-arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمُزَّمِّلُ
5476.verse-english: O you who wraps himself [in clothing],

clauses-arabic.clause: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمُزَّمِّلُ

clauses-english.clause: O you who wraps himself [in clothing],

5477.verse-english: Arise [to pray] the night, except for a little -

clauses-english.clause: Arise [to pray] the night,
except for a little -

5478.verse-english: Half of it - or subtract from it a little

clauses-english.clause: Half of it -
or subtract from it a little

5479.verse-arabic: أَوْ زِدْ عَلَيْهِ وَرَتِّلِ الْقُرْآنَ تَرْتِيلًا
5479.verse-english: Or add to it, and recite the Qur'an with measured recitation.

clauses-english.clause: Or add to it,
and recite the Qur'an with measured recitation.

5480.verse-english: Indeed, We will cast upon you a heavy word.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
We will cast upon you a heavy word.

5481.verse-arabic: إِنَّ نَاشِئَةَ اللَّيْلِ هِيَ أَشَدُّ وَطْئًا وَأَقْوَمُ قِيلًا
5481.verse-english: Indeed, the hours of the night are more effective for concurrence [of heart and tongue] and more suitable for words.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
the hours of the night are more effective for concurrence [of heart and tongue] and more suitable for words.

5482.verse-arabic: إِنَّ لَكَ فِي النَّهَارِ سَبْحًا طَوِيلًا
5482.verse-english: Indeed, for you by day is prolonged occupation.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
for you by day is prolonged occupation.

5483.verse-arabic: وَاذْكُرِ اسْمَ رَبِّكَ وَتَبَتَّلْ إِلَيْهِ تَبْتِيلًا
5483.verse-english: And remember the name of your Lord and devote yourself to Him with [complete] devotion.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَاذْكُرِ اسْمَ رَبِّكَ وَتَبَتَّلْ إِلَيْهِ تَبْتِيلًا

clauses-english.clause: And remember the name of your Lord and devote yourself to Him with [complete] devotion.

5484.verse-arabic: رَّبُّ الْمَشْرِقِ وَالْمَغْرِبِ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ فَاتَّخِذْهُ وَكِيلًا
5484.verse-english: [He is] the Lord of the East and the West; there is no deity except Him, so take Him as Disposer of [your] affairs.

clauses-english.clause: [He is] the Lord of the East and the West;
there is no deity except Him,
so take Him as Disposer of [your] affairs.

5485.verse-arabic: وَاصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَاهْجُرْهُمْ هَجْرًا جَمِيلًا
5485.verse-english: And be patient over what they say and avoid them with gracious avoidance.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَاصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَاهْجُرْهُمْ هَجْرًا جَمِيلًا

clauses-english.clause: And be patient over what they say and avoid them with gracious avoidance.

5486.verse-arabic: وَذَرْنِي وَالْمُكَذِّبِينَ أُولِي النَّعْمَةِ وَمَهِّلْهُمْ قَلِيلًا
5486.verse-english: And leave Me with [the matter of] the deniers, those of ease [in life], and allow them respite a little.

clauses-english.clause: And leave Me with [the matter of] the deniers,
those of ease [in life],
and allow them respite a little.

5487.verse-english: Indeed, with Us [for them] are shackles and burning fire

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
with Us [for them] are shackles and burning fire

5488.verse-english: And food that chokes and a painful punishment -

clauses-english.clause: And food that chokes and a painful punishment -

5489.verse-arabic: يَوْمَ تَرْجُفُ الْأَرْضُ وَالْجِبَالُ وَكَانَتِ الْجِبَالُ كَثِيبًا مَّهِيلًا
5489.verse-english: On the Day the earth and the mountains will convulse and the mountains will become a heap of sand pouring down.

clauses-arabic.clause: يَوْمَ تَرْجُفُ الْأَرْضُ وَالْجِبَالُ وَكَانَتِ الْجِبَالُ كَثِيبًا مَّهِيلًا

clauses-english.clause: On the Day the earth and the mountains will convulse and the mountains will become a heap of sand pouring down.

5490.verse-arabic: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا إِلَيْكُمْ رَسُولًا شَاهِدًا عَلَيْكُمْ كَمَا أَرْسَلْنَا إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ رَسُولًا
5490.verse-english: Indeed, We have sent to you a Messenger as a witness upon you just as We sent to Pharaoh a messenger.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
We have sent to you a Messenger as a witness upon you just as We sent to Pharaoh a messenger.

5491.verse-arabic: فَعَصَىٰ فِرْعَوْنُ الرَّسُولَ فَأَخَذْنَاهُ أَخْذًا وَبِيلًا
5491.verse-english: But Pharaoh disobeyed the messenger, so We seized him with a ruinous seizure.

clauses-english.clause: But Pharaoh disobeyed the messenger,
so We seized him with a ruinous seizure.

5492.verse-arabic: فَكَيْفَ تَتَّقُونَ إِن كَفَرْتُمْ يَوْمًا يَجْعَلُ الْوِلْدَانَ شِيبًا
5492.verse-english: Then how can you fear, if you disbelieve, a Day that will make the children white- haired?

clauses-english.clause: Then how can you fear,
if you disbelieve,
a Day that will make the children white-
haired?

5493.verse-arabic: السَّمَاءُ مُنفَطِرٌ بِهِ ۚ كَانَ وَعْدُهُ مَفْعُولًا
5493.verse-english: The heaven will break apart therefrom; ever is His promise fulfilled.

clauses-english.clause: The heaven will break apart therefrom;
ever is His promise fulfilled.

5494.verse-arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِ تَذْكِرَةٌ ۖ فَمَن شَاءَ اتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِ سَبِيلًا
5494.verse-english: Indeed, this is a reminder, so whoever wills may take to his Lord a way.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
this is a reminder,
so whoever wills may take to his Lord a way.

5495.verse-arabic: ۞ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَعْلَمُ أَنَّكَ تَقُومُ أَدْنَىٰ مِن ثُلُثَيِ اللَّيْلِ وَنِصْفَهُ وَثُلُثَهُ وَطَائِفَةٌ مِّنَ الَّذِينَ مَعَكَ ۚ وَاللَّهُ يُقَدِّرُ اللَّيْلَ وَالنَّهَارَ ۚ عَلِمَ أَن لَّن تُحْصُوهُ فَتَابَ عَلَيْكُمْ ۖ فَاقْرَءُوا مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنَ الْقُرْآنِ ۚ عَلِمَ أَن سَيَكُونُ مِنكُم مَّرْضَىٰ ۙ وَآخَرُونَ يَضْرِبُونَ فِي الْأَرْضِ يَبْتَغُونَ مِن فَضْلِ اللَّهِ ۙ وَآخَرُونَ يُقَاتِلُونَ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ۖ فَاقْرَءُوا مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنْهُ ۚ وَأَقِيمُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَآتُوا الزَّكَاةَ وَأَقْرِضُوا اللَّهَ قَرْضًا حَسَنًا ۚ وَمَا تُقَدِّمُوا لِأَنفُسِكُم مِّنْ خَيْرٍ تَجِدُوهُ عِندَ اللَّهِ هُوَ خَيْرًا وَأَعْظَمَ أَجْرًا ۚ وَاسْتَغْفِرُوا اللَّهَ ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
5495.verse-english: Indeed, your Lord knows, [O Muhammad], that you stand [in prayer] almost two thirds of the night or half of it or a third of it, and [so do] a group of those with you. And Allah determines [the extent of] the night and the day. He has known that you [Muslims] will not be able to do it and has turned to you in forgiveness, so recite what is easy [for you] of the Qur'an. He has known that there will be among you those who are ill and others traveling throughout the land seeking [something] of the bounty of Allah and others fighting for the cause of Allah. So recite what is easy from it and establish prayer and give zakah and loan Allah a goodly loan. And whatever good you put forward for yourselves - you will find it with Allah. It is better and greater in reward. And seek forgiveness of Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
your Lord knows,
[O Muhammad],
that you stand [in prayer] almost two thirds of the night or half of it or a third of it,
and [so do] a group of those with you.
And God determines [the extent of] the night and the day.
He has known that you [Muslims] will not be able to do it and has turned to you in forgiveness,
so recite what is easy [for you] of the Qur'an.
He has known that there will be among you those who are ill and others traveling throughout the land seeking [something] of the bounty of God and others fighting for the cause of God.
So recite what is easy from it and establish prayer and give zakah and loan God a goodly loan.
And whatever good you put forward for yourselves -
you will find it with God.
It is better and greater in reward.
And seek forgiveness of God.
Indeed,
God is Forgiving and Merciful.
